availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Tecumseh Milam (Franklin Co, Ky, merchant and pvt 22nd KY Inf USA)

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, soldier and merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Morgan Milam in Clark County, Indiana, on October 15, 1854. Father of John Morgan Milam, Anna B. Milam, William Milam, Charles Milam. Merchant in Franklin County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 22nd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private from January 10, 1862, to January 21, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 2, p. 331.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, La Grange, p. 66A.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 398.
Indiana Marriage Records, Clark County Marriages, Film #001415852, p. 554.
Find A Grave, "John Tecumseh Milam (1832-1875)," Memorial #75650918, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/75650918 (accessed February 13, 2019).
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 98.
